verb.description: Make (an argument, statement, or theory) unsound or erroneous.
synonyms: drive a coach and horses through

verb.description: Deprive (an official document or procedure) of legal efficacy because of contravention of a regulation or law.
examples: a technical flaw in her papers invalidated her nomination

origin: Mid 17th century: from medieval Latin invalidat- annulled, from the verb invalidare (based on Latin validus strong).
